PageTitle: mpls rsvp-te authentication window-size (MPLS RSVP-TE neighbor view)
FuncDef:
The mpls rsvp-te authentication window-size command is used to configure the RSVP authentication message sliding window size.
The undo mpls rsvp-te authentication window-size command is used to remove the RSVP authentication message sliding window size.
By default, the maximum number of RSVP authentication messages that a device can receive is 1.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the size of a sliding window.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 64. The default value is 1.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If you need to enhance the system's ability to authenticate users in a bad network environment such as network congestion and improve their security, you are recommended to configure RSVP authentication enhancement.
Setting the window size to a value greater than 32 is recommended. If the size of a sliding window is small, the RSVP messages may be dropped and the RSVP neighbor relationship may be terminated.
